metadata.name: Uncommon System Information Discovery Via Wmic.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the use of the WMI command-line (WMIC) utility to identify and display various system information, including OS, CPU, GPU, and disk drive names; memory capacity; display resolution; and baseboard, BIOS, and GPU driver products/versions. Some of these commands were used by Aurora Stealer in late 2022/early 2023.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND lower(device.desc) = lower('wmi commandline utility') AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('wmic.exe') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\wmic.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('logicaldisk get name,size,freespace')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('os get caption,osarchitecture,version'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of the WMI command-line (WMIC) utility to identify and display various system information, including OS, CPU, GPU, and disk drive names; memory capacity; display resolution; and baseboard, BIOS, and GPU driver products/versions. Some of these commands were used by Aurora Stealer in late 2022/early 2023.
